CARDINAL . If the accused has not chosen a defence counsel , the trial court will appoint CARDINAL in the following cases ( listed in Article CARDINAL para . CARDINAL of the Code of Criminal Procedure ) :

- the proceedings may result in the accused ’s being prohibited from exercising a profession ;

An appointment will also be made in other cases , either by the court of its own motion or at the accused ’s request , if such a step appears necessary on account of the seriousness of the act in question , the factual or legal complexity of the case , or if it is obvious that the accused can not conduct his own defence ( Article CARDINAL para .
